traits.name: Adrenaline Surge
traits.description: While below 50% of your maximum Hit Points, you gain a +2 bonus to all damage dealt. However, while above 50% of your maximum Hit Points, you receive a -2 penalty instead.

traits.name: Blind Emotions
traits.description: You permanently benefit from the effects of being Calmed. However, your targeting range is limited to 3m/10ft.

traits.name: Bloody Results
traits.description: Gain a bonus to damage dealt equal to your Proficiency Bonus. However, when dealing damage, you also damage yourself for the same amount.

traits.name: Borrowed Time
traits.description: At the beginning of any combat encounter, you receive Temporary Hit Points equal to your level multiplied by two. Upon ending combat, you lose the temporary HP and you take damage equal to your level multiplied by four.

traits.name: Breathe Deep
traits.description: Gain the ability to center yourself with a deep breath, restoring both your Action and Bonus Action. At the end of your turn, you immediately fall Unconscious, causing you to lose your next turn.

traits.name: Confidently Incorrect
traits.description: Upon casting a Spell, there is a 10% chance that it will erupt in a violent explosion, damaging everything within 3m/10ft of your target.

traits.name: Critical Loss
traits.description: Reduce the number needed to roll a Critical Hit by 2. However, your Critical Hits deal half of their normal damage.

traits.name: Crybaby
traits.description: Upon being damaged while not enraged, you immediately fall Prone and begin to cry. Upon starting your next turn, you become enraged for three turns.

traits.name: Delusions in the Dark
traits.description: Gain Resistance to Necrotic damage and status immunity to Fear-based effects. However, you also become Vulnerable to Radiant damage.

traits.name: Gambler
traits.description: Upon starting your turn in combat, you have a 10% chance to only roll Critical Hits. However, you also have a 10% chance to lose your turn entirely.

traits.name: Gentle Giant
traits.description: Upon dealing damage with melee-based Attack Rolls, you deal an additional 1d4 damage. However, when dealing damage, there is a 5% chance you will immediately die.

traits.name: Gilded Pilfer
traits.description: When dealing damage, you deal an additional point of damage for every ten gold pieces your target has in their inventory, consuming it in the process.

traits.name: Glass Cannon
traits.description: Gain an additional Action and Bonus Action. However, you also receive a -10 penalty to your Armour Class, and your maximum Hit Points are halved.

traits.name: Hands of Calamity
traits.description: Upon killing an enemy with a melee-based Attack Roll, all creatures within 3m/10ft of them receive 1d12 Force damage, including you.

traits.name: Hasty Reflexes
traits.description: Gain an additional Reaction. When making an Attack Roll which uses a Reaction, you roll with Disadvantage.

traits.name: Haymaker
traits.description: Gain a +5 bonus to all Attack Rolls. However, you are unable to roll Critical Hits.

traits.name: Healthy Chills
traits.description: When being healed, you always recover the maximum amount of Hit Points possible. However, upon being healed, you also become Bone Chilled for three turns.

traits.name: Heavy Handed
traits.description: Melee-based Critical Hits will Daze your target for three turns. However, your melee-based Attack Rolls also push your target back by 3m/10ft.

traits.name: Hyperfixation
traits.description: You have Advantage on all Concentration based Saving Throws. However, upon starting your turn while not Concentrating, you have a 10% chance to become Stunned and lose your turn.

traits.name: Ironborne
traits.description: You are considered to be a Construct, and as such, gain status based immunity to a number of conditions. However, during combat, you cannot be healed.

traits.name: Immovable Boulder
traits.description: You are unable to be forcibly moved or fall Prone. However, you have a -10 penalty to your Initiative.

traits.name: Lefty
traits.description: Gain the ability to make an off-hand weapon attack as a Bonus Action, and all off-hand based Attack Rolls are rolled with Advantage. However, all Attack Rolls made with your main-hand are rolled with Disadvantage.

traits.name: Let Me Solo Them
traits.description: You will always roll Critical Hits, and your Hit Points are doubled. However, you are unable to utilize Attunement. Warning: Taking this trait will drastically impact intended game balance.

traits.name: Lone Wolf
traits.description: As long as you do not have more than 2 party members, gain an additional Action, Bonus Action, Reaction, and your maximum Hit Points are doubled. If you are the only one in your party, double these positive effects. Warning: Taking this trait will drastically impact intended game balance, and is made for solo or dual runs.

traits.name: Narcoleptic
traits.description: Upon starting your turn, you have a 33% chance to fall Asleep. Upon waking from a sleep-based Condition, you receive Temporary Hit Points equal to your level multiplied by 4.

traits.name: Natural Medium
traits.description: Permanently gain the effects of Detect Thoughts, Speak with Animals, and Speak with Dead. However, you make all Charisma based Skill Checks with a -2 penalty.

traits.name: Overcharged
traits.description: When dealing damage with Spells, you deal additional damage equal to your Proficiency Bonus. However, you also have Disadvantage on all Constitution-based Saving Throws.

traits.name: Overly Difficult
traits.description: Spells you cast increase their Difficulty Class by two. However, you make all Saving Throws with Disadvantage.

traits.name: Packing
traits.description: Double your Carrying Capacity. However, your Movement Speed is reduced by 3m/10ft.

traits.name: Planar Skipping
traits.description: Each turn, you may teleport up to 18m/60ft as a free action. However, you also have a 33% chance upon doing so to be suddenly Banished.

traits.name: Reactive Loss
traits.description: You no longer provoke Opportunity Attacks. However, you are unable to utilize your Reactions during combat.

traits.name: Reckless
traits.description: Gain Advantage on all Attack Rolls and damage rolls. However, you also become Vulnerable to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage.

traits.name: Slow Roller
traits.description: Your Movement Speed is halved. However, upon damaging an enemy with a melee-based Attack Roll, you halve their Movement Speed as well.

traits.name: Stinky
traits.description: You gain status-based immunity to Noxious Fumes, and upon starting your turn, you create a 3m/10ft cloud of Noxious Gas. However, you make all Charisma-based Ability Checks with Disadvantage.

traits.name: Split Focus
traits.description: Gain the ability to target two enemies at once with your weapon-based Attack Rolls. However, all weapon-based Attack Rolls also deal half damage.

traits.name: Sunlight Aversion
traits.description: While in an obscured area, you gain Advantage on all Attack Rolls. However, while unobscured, you roll with Disadvantage instead.

traits.name: Unhinged
traits.description: While in combat, killing another creature will immediately restore 1d12 Hit Points. However, if you fail to kill a creature within three turns, you become permanently Mad until you do.

traits.name: Unstable Source
traits.description: Each turn in combat, you have a 10% chance to experience a positive surge of Wild Magic. However, upon recovering from being Downed, you have a 100% chance to experience a negative surge.

traits.name: Waning Immortality
traits.description: Your maximum Hit Points are tripled. However, each time that you go down, your maximum Hit Points are permanently reduced by 4. This reduction in Hit Points cannot be undone.

traits.name: Wretch
traits.description: You make all Attack Rolls, Ability Checks, and Saving Throws with Disadvantage. Warning: Taking this trait will drastically impact intended game balance.
